clinicalText: 34-year-old male presenting with chest pain and dyspnea on exertion. Patient reports symptoms started 3 days ago.
diagnosis: Rule out pulmonary embolism, coronary artery disease
findings: Chest CT shows normal lung parenchyma bilaterally
No evidence of pulmonary embolism or pneumonia
conclusion: Normal chest CT. No acute cardiopulmonary abnormalities detected.
recommendations: Clinical follow-up recommended if symptoms persist. Consider cardiac stress testing.
